title: In what search did the Internet give you only out-dated information today? - Quora

response.answer_text: None. You need to learn how to use a search engine, do you know about syntax and search operators? Google has many different ways to conduct a search meeting your needs. I can't go into all of them, books have been written on the subject, unfortunately most are out of date as soon as they are published. Have you ever used Google Advanced Search? You can set all kinds of parameters using this portal including but not limited to dates, countries, and file types. You can conduct a search within a particular site. Here is the link to Googles Advanced Image Search, again with a lot of parameters you adjust, Google Advanced Image Search Don't limit yourself to Google searching, by most accounts they have only indexed around 30% of the internet so you are missing out. There is one more thing when using general Google search; you must clear all cookies and prior Google searches on a regular basis. I do it weekly, the reason is that Google has algorithms that automatically assumes those prior sites are “favorites” of yours, and directs you to them. It sucks. For now we have to make the best of it, clear your search results in settings, I can't go into details on how to do it, you can figure it out. There is so much more, ever used the LOC (Library Of Congress) search? All printed media ever published they have available to anyone. This site is hard to admittedly use, it's just not user friendly, Search/Browse Help - Browse There are so many more good, effective ways to search the internet than putting all your eggs in one basket (Google basic search). Another one I turn to now and again is Pinterest, granted it's mostly images but there are more likely than not links corresponding to the picture that you will not find otherwise. I could go on but that's enough for now. I truly wish schools would devout one whole semester to teaching students how to conduct effective internet searches, it is so important now a days. You are not alone, or being singled out, please follow the below link, it gives current Google search syntax and search operators, (they change them all the time). I just picked one site that only scratches the surface of getting better Google search results. Google Advanced Search Operators: 52 Google Search Commands://www.spyfu.com/blog/google-search-operators/
